body:
Logotipo # Access To access the RESTful interface the external system should support basi authentication (Login and Password), which must be previously configured in the application. *+The external system should pass this credencials on the HTTP(Hypertext Transfer Protocol) header on each request+*. Otherwhise the response will be "Access denied". # Request/Response format * Being the API prepared to respond in several formats, for now just JSON((JavaScript Object Notation) format is supported. All responses and requests are made in this format, so it is necessary to configure the client to interpret JSON. * All request should be made to the *subdomain* provided, followed by the domain *lagoonsecurity.dyndns.org:9091/api* > Example > https://demo.lagoonsecurity.dyndns.org:9091/api/sanitycheck * The error codes used by the API are following: ## HTTP(Hypertext Transfer Protocol) Error codes *200* - Successfull request and valid response
*400* - Bad request
*403* - Limited permissions
*404* - Not found
*409* - Request generated conflicts
*500* - For all other invalid requests
*503* - Unknown errors or temporarily not available * All input parameters signed with * are mandatory. All other parameters are optional and can be used to exploit the API's functionalities. * For integration tests we recommend "REST Console": http://www.codeinchaos.com/post/3610180596/rest-console-a-google-chrome-rest-http-client", or any other client you like. * All resources available via RESTful API must be enabled at project#2. Otherwhise it will not be possible to visualize them or interact with them. ---- # Lagoon RESTful API Summary of supported URI(Uniform Resource Identifier) **Authentication Test**
GET /sanitycheck/{version}
GET /sanitycheck **Application Management**
GET / **Profiles Management**
GET /profiles **User Management**
POST /users
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}
GET /users
PUT /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/deactivate
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/activate
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/reactivate
DELETE /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}
POST /users/login
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/logout
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/permissions
POST /users/register
GET /users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/profiles **Context Management**
GET /contexts
POST /contexts
GET /contexts/{cname}
PUT /contexts/{cname}
DELETE /contexts/{cname}
GET /contexts/{cname}/enable
GET /contexts/{cname}/disable **Contextualized resources Management**
GET /contexts/{cname}/profiles
POST /contexts/{cname}/users
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}
GET /contexts/{cname}/users
PUT /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/deactivate
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/activate
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/reactivate
DELETE /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/reactivate
POST /contexts/{cname}/users/login
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/logout
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/permissions
POST /contexts/{cname}/users/register
GET /contexts/{cname}/users/{<[0-9]+>user_id}/profiles ---- # Request Description ## Authentication/Autorization Test: ### /sanitycheck Checks the authentication credentials and that the application is active. Returns the message "Application appName is ok!". This message indicates that the credencials are correct and the application is ready to interact with project#2. Compatibility between versions is not garanteed. **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** N/A
**Example Input:**
**Example Output:** 
{
    sanity: true,
    message: "Application xcoisas - demo is ok!",
    version: "0.1beta"
}
**/sanitycheck/**
Checks compatibility between versions. The request is made with a parameter _version_ and project#2 indicates if this version is comptible with its own using the _sanity_ flag. **Example**:
/sanitycheck/0.1beta2 **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **version** Identification of the version used by the client
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output**
{
    sanity: true,
    message: "Application xcoisas - demo is ok!",
    version: "0.1beta"
}
**Exemplo Output**
with non compatible version 
{
    sanity: false,
    message: "Version :: 0.1beta2 :: not supported",
    version: "0.1beta"
}
## Management of the application instance Retrieves all information about the application instance which corresponds to the login and organization being used. Must be prevously configured at project#2. **HTTP Method :** GET
**Parameters:** N/A
**Example input:** N/A
**Example Output: ** 
{
    "notify": true,
    "activationUrl": "",
    "description": "",
    "name": "demo",
    "url": "",
    "application": {
        "description": "Buy and Sell your products",
        "name": "xcoisas"
    }
}
## Profiles Management ###/profiles
Retrieves a list of all active profiles of the application **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** N/A
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
[{
    "id": 16,
    "defaultProfile": false,
    "description": "admin profile",
    "name": "admin"
}, {
    "id": 17,
    "defaultProfile": false,
    "description": "",
    "name": "test"
}, {
    "id": 18,
    "defaultProfile": true,
    "description": "",
    "name": "guest"
}]
---- ## User Management ###/users
Creates a new User. If no profile is specified the user will be associated with the "guest" profiles, which may or may not have active permissions. The option field "ghost" allows the creation of ghost users which are users who don't receive any kind of notification whenever they are activated/deactivated. **HTTP Method:** POST
**Paramenters:** N/A
**Example Input** 
{
   *"login": "user1",
   *"email": "user1@mail.pt",
   *"name": "User1",
    "ghost":false,
    "profiles": [
        {
            "name": "admin"
        }
    ]
}
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": false,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user1@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }],
    "token": "7fcebcdeb9f84a329d84ef56d11ee89a1343212496121"
}
###/users/register
Registers a users password of a newly created user and activates his account. **HTTP Method:** POST
**Parameters:** N/A
**Example Input** 
{
   *"token":"7fcebcdeb9f84a329d84ef56d11ee89a1343212496121",
   *"password": "pass"
}
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user1@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "profile": "admin",
        "actions": {
            "Users": ["reactivate", "deactivate", "show", "activate", "index"],
            "Application": ["index"],
            "Apps": ["show"],
            "Contexts": ["show", "update", "index", "delete", "edit", "save", "create"],
            "Permissions": ["index"]
        }
    }]
}
###/users/{id_u}/activate Activate an users account. Can only be used for disabled users which already where registered. **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **id_u** User Identification
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user1@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "profile": "admin",
        "actions": {
            "Users": ["reactivate", "deactivate", "show", "activate", "index"],
            "Application": ["index"],
            "Apps": ["show"],
            "Contexts": ["show", "update", "index", "delete", "edit", "save", "create"],
            "Permissions": ["index"]
        }
    }]
}
###/users/{id_u}/deactivate Disables an users account. Can only be used for active users. **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **id_u** User Identification
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": false,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "profile": "admin",
        "actions": {
            "Users": ["reactivate", "deactivate", "show", "activate", "index"],
            "Application": ["index"],
            "Apps": ["show"],
            "Contexts": ["show", "update", "index", "delete", "edit", "save", "create"],
            "Permissions": ["index"]
        }
    }]
}
###/users/{id_u}/reactivate Reactivates an users account. This means the user receives a new notification with an activation url. Can only be used for users which where never registered. **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **id_u** User identification
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user1@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "profile": "admin",
        "actions": {
            "Users": ["reactivate", "deactivate", "show", "activate", "index"],
            "Application": ["index"],
            "Apps": ["show"],
            "Contexts": ["show", "update", "index", "delete", "edit", "save", "create"],
            "Permissions": ["index"]
        }
    }],
    "token": "df8c7e2b9950479fb327b3c336f472021343212870715"
}
###/users/{id_u} Deletes an user. **HTTP Method:** DELETE
**Parameters** **id_u** User identification
**Example Input** N/A
**Example Output** 
{
    "success": true
}
###/users Retrieves a list of all users (active or not). **HTTP Method** GET
**Parameters:** N/A
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
[{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user1@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }]
}, {
    "id": 14,
    "enable": false,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user2",
    "name": "user2",
    "email": "user2@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}]
###/users/{id_u} Retrieves all information about an user. **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:**id_u** User identification
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user1",
    "name": "User1",
    "email": "user1@mai.pt"
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }]
}
###/users/{id_u} Updated an User. **HTTP Method:** PUT
**Parameters:** **id_u** User Identification **Example Input** 
{
    *"login": "user3",
    *"email": "user3@mail.pt",
    *"name": "user1"
}
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user3",
    "name": "user1",
    "email": "user1@mail.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}
###/users/login User Login. The response contains all information about the users access permission (profiles, actions and action points) **HTTP Method:**POST
**Parameters:** N/A
**Example input **
{ *login: user3, *password: pass } Example Output 
{
    "id": 13,
    "enable": true,
    "ghost": false,
    "login": "user3",
    "name": "user1",
    "email": "user1@xlm.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "profile": "guest",
        "actions": {
            "Conditions": ["edit", "index", "show", "update", "create", "delete", "save"],
            "Types": ["delete", "show", "create", "update", "save", "index", "edit"],
            "Users": ["edit", "indexByContext", "show", "update", "showUser"],
            "Purchases": ["index"],
            "Products": ["show", "save", "create", "buy", "delete", "index", "update", "edit"],
            "Application": ["index"]
        }
    }],
    "lastLogin": 1343213324000
}
###/users/{id_u}/logout User Logout **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **id_u** User Identification
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output ** 
{
    success: true
}
---- ## Permissions ###/users/{id_u}/permissions Retrieves users permissions ordered by Profile/Action/ActionPoint. If an actionPoint is not present it means the user has no permission to use it **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **id_u** User Identification
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output:** 
[{
    "profile": "guest",
    "actions": {
        "Conditions": ["edit", "index", "show", "update", "create", "delete", "save"],
        "Types": ["delete", "show", "create", "update", "save", "index", "edit"],
        "Users": ["edit", "indexByContext", "show", "update", "showUser"],
        "Purchases": ["index"],
        "Products": ["show", "save", "create", "buy", "delete", "index", "update", "edit"],
        "Application": ["index"]
    }
}]
## Contextualized Resources Client applications which need to contextualized their resources (used of subdomains, for example) should used specific routes. When building the route dinamically it is only necessary to include the _context_ resource followed by the name of the context to use. **Example:**
* / *contexts/xyz/* users/34/activate This URI will activate the userd with id _34_ inserted in context _xyz_ All parameters are the same as in the previously decribed routes. ## Context Management At project:lagoon contexts are used as users and profiles agglomerators. This allows the client applications to support their contexts, as for example, subdomains. It can only be made use of contexts if the application if configured to operate in Saas mode. ##contexts Restrieves a list of all contexts **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:**N/A
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** 
[{
    "id": 19,
    "defaultContext": true,
    "enable": true,
    "name": "default",
    "description": "Default Context",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}, {
    "id": 21,
    "defaultContext": false,
    "enable": true,
    "name": "admin",
    "description": "administration area",
    "activationUrl": "",
    "url": "http://admin.lvh.me:9000/",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 17,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "",
        "name": "test"
    }, {
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }, {
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}, {
    "id": 20,
    "defaultContext": false,
    "enable": true,
    "name": "test",
    "description": "context context",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 17,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "",
        "name": "test"
    }, {
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }, {
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}, {
    "id": 22,
    "defaultContext": false,
    "enable": true,
    "name": "xcoisas",
    "description": "",
    "activationUrl": "http://xcoisas.lvh.me:9000/activation",
    "url": "http://xcoisas.lvh.me:9000",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 17,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "",
        "name": "test"
    }, {
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }, {
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}]
##/contexts Creates a new context. The parameter _copycontext_ can be used to copy profiles from the indicated context. It not set all enabled context are associated to the new context. **HTTP Method:**POST
**Parameters:**N/A
**Exemplo Input** 
{
     *"name": "context name",
     "activationUrl": "www.example.pt",
     "url": "www.admin.pt",
     "description": "context description",
     "copycontext": "test"
}
**Exemplo Output** 
{
    "id": 23,
    "defaultContext": false,
    "enable": true, 
    "name": "context name",
    "description": "context description",
    "activationUrl": "http://www.example.pt",
    "url": "http://www.admin.pt",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 17,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "",
        "name": "test"
    }, {
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }, {
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}
###/contexts/{cname} Updates a context **HTTP Method:** PUT
**Parameters** **cname** Context Name
**Example Input** 
{
    *"name": "editado",
    "description": "Default Context",
    "url": "http://www.example.com",
     "activationUrl": "http://www.example.com/activation"
}
**Example Output** 
{
    "id": 19,
    "defaultContext": false,
    "enable": true, 
    "name": "editado",
    "description": "Default Context",
    "activationUrl": "http://www.example.com/activation",
    "url": "http://www.example.com",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}
###/contexts/{cname} Retrieves a contexts information **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parametros:** **cname** Context Name
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output:** 
{
    "id": 21,
    "defaultContext": false,
    "enable": true, 
    "name": "admin",
    "description": "administration area",
    "activationUrl": "",
    "url": "http://admin.lvh.me:9000/",
    "profiles": [{
        "id": 17,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "",
        "name": "test"
    }, {
        "id": 16,
        "defaultProfile": false,
        "description": "admin profile",
        "name": "admin"
    }, {
        "id": 18,
        "defaultProfile": true,
        "description": "",
        "name": "guest"
    }]
}
###/contexts/{cname} Deletes a context. Default context can not be deleted **HTTP Method:** DELETE
**Parameters** **cname** Context Name
**Example Input:**N/A
**Example Output** 
{
    success: true
}
###/contexts/{cname}/enable Enables context **HTTP Method:** GET
**Parameters:** **cname** Context name
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output:** N/A 
{
    success: true
}
###/contexts/{cname}/disable Disables context. Default Context can not be disabled
**Verbo HTTP:** GET
**Parameters:** **cname** Context name
**Example Input:** N/A
**Example Output** N/A 
{
    success: true
}
name: Lagoon-rest-api
